items.content:
The subject of this double period is farm animals.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Have you ever visited a farm?
  • What do you know about farm animals?
  • Would you like to work on a farm?
Step activiteit
activity		 leerdoel
aim		 tijd
time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 reading
A visit to the farm		 You can understand a text about a visit to a farm and answer questions. 15
Step 2 listening
Animal hospital		 You can understand a video about lambing and answer questions. 15
Step 3 vocabulary You can understand and use vocabulary about farm animals. 15
Step 4 grammar
Personal pronouns		 You can understand and use personal pronouns. 15
Step 5 speaking
Speech card		 You can have a conversation talking about your visit to the a farm. 10
Step 6 writing
An email about visiting a farm		 You can write an email about your visit to a farm. 15
Step 7 evaluation Reflect on what you have learnt. 05

A visit to the farm
You are going to read a text about a visit to a farm.

  • Read the text.
  • Answer the questions.
A visit to the farm
It's Sunday, the day after the house-warming party. Andreas and Maria are taking Anna, Pedro, Michael and Josh to a farm outside Filton. When they arrive, the farmer's wife is just entering the hen house. They follow her.
Farmer's wife: Hi, can I help you?
Andreas: Hi, could we have a look around?
Farmer's wife: Of course! Just a minute, I'm just feeding the hens and collecting their eggs. Then I can show you around.
While they are waiting, they look around and see horses running in the fields.
Anna: Do you have any baby horses?
Farmer's wife: A baby horse is called a foal. But no, we don't have any foals yet. But we do have some lambs.
They walk across the farmyard. Two dogs are following them.
Maria: I love dogs! Do you also have any cats?
Farmer's wife: Yes, we do. They are probably playing in the hay right now.
The group arrives at the sheep.
Maria: They are so cute! And look, there's a cat hiding behind the fence! How cute!
Farmer's wife: Yes, that one is very shy. Do you want to go to the horses now? I think my husband is feeding them. Maybe you can help him.
They meet the farmer. He gives the kids some carrots so they can feed the horses.
Farmer: You are doing a great job! Why don't you come back and try horseback riding some day!
They promise to come back soon.

content.body:
Are the following statements true or false?

1. The house-warming party was on Sunday. True / False
2. Pedro and Anna take Maria and Andreas to the farm. True / False
3. The farmer's wife is feeding the chickens. True / False
4. The farmer's wife is selling eggs. True / False
5. There are cows in the fields next to the farm. True / False
6. At the moment there are no foals on the farm. True / False
7. There are some lambs on the farm. True / False
8. There are no pets on the farm. True / False
9. After the sheep they visit the horses. True / False
10. They are invited to come back to ride the horses. True / False

items.content:
Normal lambing
You are going to watch a video about lambing. First Adam Henson explains what happens, than you can see a ewe in labour.

  • Do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions (assignment 2).
  • Do assignment 3.

Assignment 1

Answer the following questions:

  1. Have you ever been on a farm?
  2. What do you know about sheep?
  3. What is a ewe?

Assignment 2

Read the following questions:

  1. How does a ewe behave when a lamb is going to be born?
  2. In what position is a lamb born?
  3. How long does the first stage of labour take?
  4. How long does the second stage of labour take?
  5. Why does a ewe lick her lamb?
  6. What information do you get about the milk?

Assignment 3

Watch the video and make the exercise.

prompt.body: How does a ewe behave when a lamb is going to be born?

content.body: She lies down and doesn't move.
She makes a lot of noise and walks around.
She becomes restless and moves away from the flock.

prompt.body: In what position is a lamb born?

content.body: The two front feet and nose come out first.
The two front feet come out first.

prompt.body: How long does the first stage of labour take?

content.body: The last three to six hours before lambing.
The last four to seven hours before lambing.
The last three to seven hours before lambing.

prompt.body: How long does the second stage of labour take?

content.body: It can take a few minutes and an hour.
It can take a few hours.
It can take from a few minutes to an hour.

prompt.body: Why does a ewe lick her lamb?

content.body: She is drying it, stimulating it's circulation and bonding with it.
She is checking if her lamb is alive.

prompt.body: What information do you get about the milk?

content.body: It protects the newborn from many diseases.
It is very fat, thick and contains vital antibodies.
It is low in energy and contains many diseases.

items.content:
Study the words and phrases well.
Leer de woorden en zinnen goed.
If you want, you can also study the vocabulary on Wozzol:
Als je wilt kun je de woordenlijst ook oefenen op Wozzol:

Woordenlijst Farm animals hv12
  • Study the vocabulary. (No more than 10 minutes.)
  • Do the exercise.

Tip!
There are different ways to study vocabulary. Click the red arrow to select another way.
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes en zinnen te leren. Klik op de rode pijl om een andere manier te kiezen.

You can read the words aloud or copy them.
Je kunt de woorden hardop oplezen of overschrijven.

The most important rule is not to study for too long in one go, because you won't learn any more. You will learn more in two 10-minute sessions than in half an hour.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer. In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

content.body:

Choose from:
collecting - eggs - ewes - fence - flock - foals - hay - horseback riding - lambs - outside

My uncle has a farm Oxford.

items.content:
Personal pronouns
In Theme 1 you've learned about personal pronouns.
Have a look at the 'Kennisbank' again.
Practise with the following exercises.

Personal pronouns


Do the following exercises.

content.body:
Fill in the right personal pronoun.

is dreaming. (George).

is green. (The blackboard).

are on the wall. (The posters).

is running. (The dog).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

are watching TV. (My mother and I).

are in the garden. (The flowers).

is riding his bike. (Tom).

is from Bristol. (Victoria).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

has got a brother. (Diana).

Have got a computer, Mandy?

The teacher always gives homework. (The students).

I am reading the book to . (My little sister).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

The boys are riding . (Their bikes).

My father is writing a letter to . (John).

I don't know . (The answer).

Sally is going to . (Anne).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

Open please. (The window).

Can you tell the way to the airport please? (The people).

The books are for . (Peter).

Can you help , please? (Me and my sister).

prompt.body:
Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
My mother always gives ... a cookie after dinner. (My brother)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... is reading a book. (My dad)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
Your niece always reads to ... . (Her brother and sister)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
The dog lost ... . (The tennis ball)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... are cycling to school. (James, Ester and Renee)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... are reading a book in class. (My classmates and I)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
I am writing a letter to ... . (Jack)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... is drawing a cow. (Mandy)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
These sweets are for ... . (You and me)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
The video is for ... . (The children)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... is from Germany. (My aunt)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
The toy truck is for ... . (Her little brother)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... is not far from London. (Manchester)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... often come and see us. (Theo and Leah)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
Would ... like this, Joy?

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
... like Disney films. (My children)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
My name is Robert Fleck. ... am a firefighter.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
His friends are so strong. ... are athletes.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
My doctor is from Germany. ... is a very good doctor.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.
Lucie isn´t from Russia. ... is from Brazil.

items.content:
Tell me about your visit to the farm?
Expressions: If you need some extra help, go to your StudioWozzol account and take another look at the chunks.
Now you are going to try to have a conversation with someone else.

  1. Find someone to work with and use the speech card A or B on page two.
  2. Write down a couple of words to help you during the conversation.
  3. Practise your conversation at least twice.

After practising twice, do the following things:

  1. Find another pair to work with.
  2. Act out your conversation.
  3. Let them act out their conversation and write down feedback for them.
  4. Let them do the conversation and write down feedback for them.
  5. Discuss what things were good and what you can do better next time.
    Persoon A Persoon B
    1 Groet 1 Groet terug
    2 Vraag de naam van de ander. 2 Vertel hoe je heet.
    Vraag de naam van de ander.
    3 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag of de andere wel eens op een
    boerderij is geweest.    		 3 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag of je gesprekspartner op een
    boerderij is geweest.
    4 Geef antwoord.
    Vertel hoe de boerderij eruit zag.    		 4 Vertel ook iets wat je op de boerderij
    hebt gezien
    5 Vraag welke dieren de ander heeft
    gezien.    		 5 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag wat de boer aan het doen was.
    6 Vertel welke dieren hij aan het voeren
    was.    		 6 Vraag of je gesprekspartner mocht
    helpen.
    7 Geef antwoord.
    Beëindig het gesprek.    		 7 Reageer en sluit af

An email about visiting a farm.
You are going to write an email to your pen pal from London.
Use the following prompts:

  • Say hello to your pen pal (think of a name).
  • Write about your visit to a farm.
  • Mention where the farm is.
  • Mention who you met on the farm.
  • Mention what animals you saw on the farm.
  • Mention what the farmer was doing.
  • Think of a question you could ask your pen pal.
  • Ask if your pen pal has ever
  • End your email.

What have you learnt in this double period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?
